org.orgName: United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE application of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Bond on Appeal. 3038

KNOW ALL MEN by these Presents, that we, FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF as principal and John W. Rafferty and Grace H. Rafferty and his wife and Elijah LeRoy Hollcroft and, Marjorie A Hollcroft his wife as sureties, are held and firmly bound unto THE STATE OF WASHINGTON in the penal sum of TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($250.00) to be paid to the said State of Washington; for the payment of which well and truly to be made, we bind ourselves and each of us, our and each of our heirs, executors, adminstrators and successors, jointy and severally, firmly by these presents.
Sealed without seals and dated this 30th day of September A. D. 1915.

WHEREAS, the above bounded FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF has prosecuted as appeal to the Supreme court of the UNITED STATES to reverse the judgement rendered in the above entitled cause by the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, entered in said court on the 30th day of September A.D. 1915, denying the petition of the above named petitioner for a writ of habeas corpus and his discharge thereon and remanding him to the custody of the Sheriff of King County, Washington:

NOW THEREFORE, the condition of this obligation is such that if the above bounden FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF shall prosecute said appeal to effect and shall answer all damages and costs if he shall fail to make said appeal good, then this obligation shall be void; otherwise the same shall be in full force and virtue.
Francis Stephen Medcraf John W. Rafferty Grace H Rafferty. Elijah LeRoy Hollcroft Marjorie A Hollcroft.
